message.content:
We must “build” the current accounts‐payable “balance” by adding up only those purchase transactions that used “Account Payable” as the payment method and whose payment/receipt status is Unpaid. (Any “Initial” row is a seed transaction that does not carry an AP balance.) Let’s check the transactions that meet the criteria:

• Purchase20231231001 – Type “Purchase” with amount = 60,000.0, Unpaid and Payment method “Account Payable”
• Purchase20231231006 – amount = 60,000.0, Unpaid, Payment method “Account Payable”
• Purchase20231231007 – amount = 10,000.0, Unpaid, Payment method “Account Payable”
• Purchase20231231011 – amount = 300,000.0, Unpaid, Payment method “Account Payable”
• Purchase20231231014 – amount = 2,000.0, Unpaid, Payment method “Account Payable”
• Purchase20231231016 – amount = 40,000.0, Unpaid, Payment method “Account Payable”
• Purchase20231231021 – amount = 3,000.0, Unpaid, Payment method “Account Payable”
• Purchase20231231022 – amount = 10,000.0, Unpaid, Payment method “Account Payable”

Now we add them:
 60,000.0 + 60,000.0 = 120,000.0  
 120,000.0 + 10,000.0 = 130,000.0  
 130,000.0 + 300,000.0 = 430,000.0  
 430,000.0 + 2,000.0 = 432,000.0  
 432,000.0 + 40,000.0 = 472,000.0  
 472,000.0 + 3,000.0 = 475,000.0  
 475,000.0 + 10,000.0 = 485,000.0

Since no initial “AP‐“ balance is provided in the “Initial20231231001” transactions the beginning value is zero.

Therefore, the accounts payable item in the balance sheet is:
 Initial value: 0.00  
 Final (end) value: 485000.00

Below is the answer in the requested JSON format.

------------------------------------------------

{"solution": {"Accounts Payable Initial Value": "0.00", "Accounts Payable End Value": "485000.00"}}
